definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])

sentences.english: This blind old lady relies completely on her walking stick to walk.
sentences.chinese: 这个瞎眼的老婆婆完全依靠拐棍走路。

sentences.english: I love you as much as a beggar needs a crutch.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你好比乞丐需要拐棍。

sentences.english: House: See that?They all assume I'm a patient because of this cane.
sentences.chinese: 看那，因为这根拐棍儿他们都觉得我是个病人。

sentences.english: Your friend walks in front with the cane to clear the way.
sentences.chinese: 你朋友手持拐棍在前面开道。

sentences.english: Web searching is now a big walking stick for translators.
sentences.chinese: 网络搜索现在是笔译翻译的一根大拐棍。
喏，接住你的拐棍儿，走吧。

sentences.english: The candy cane begins with a stick of white candy.
sentences.chinese: 拐棍糖开始的时候只是根白色的棍状糖果。

sentences.english: Benedict pointed downwards again with his stick.
sentences.chinese: 贝内迪克特用他的拐棍又往下指了指。

sentences.english: On crutches and supported by a friend, slowly across the road.
sentences.chinese: 他拄着拐棍，由一个朋友搀扶着，慢慢的过马路。

sentences.english: The stick of candy was striped with red.
sentences.chinese: 拐棍糖开始的时候只是根白色的棍状糖果。

sentences.english: This walking stick price-marks 55 spindles, according to the truth, does not calculate expensively .
sentences.chinese: 这个拐棍标价55锭，按照道理来说，不算贵。

sentences.english: The lame man needs a stick when he walks.
sentences.chinese: 那跛脚男子走路时需借助拐棍。

sentences.english: Nobody out there but some old gaffer with a cane.
sentences.chinese: 外面没别的人，就只有一个拄着拐棍的乡下老头。

sentences.english: She gets around with the help of a stick.
